official-title.#text:
To authorize the Secretary of Education to make grants to
		  support fire safety education programs on college campuses.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Education and the
			 Workforce

cosponsor.#tail:
)
			 introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Campus Fire Safety Education Act of
			 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

The purpose of this Act is to help provide
			 fire safety education and training to students attending institutions of higher
			 education.

header.#text:
Establishment of
			 the campus fire safety education competitive grant program

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Campus Fire Safety Education Act of 2013/s:7

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in consultation with the

, shall establish a grant
			 program to award grants, on a competitive basis, to eligible entities
			 for—

text.#text: From the amounts appropriated under

initiating,
			 expanding, or improving fire safety education programs at institutions of
			 higher education; and

increasing fire
			 safety awareness among students enrolled at such institutions, including
			 students living in off-campus housing.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
at such time, in such manner, and containing such information as
			 the
may require.

text.#text:
To
			 seek a grant under this Act, an eligible entity shall submit an application to
			 the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
			 give priority to eligible entities that plan to use grant funds received under
			 this Act to initiate, expand, or improve fire safety education programs that
			 include educational material specifically prepared for students with physical,
			 sensory, or cognitive disabilities.

text.#text: In making grants under this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: discretion.

text.#text:
Grants under this Act shall be awarded for not longer than
			 a 2-year period, and may be renewed for an additional 2-year period, at the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall ensure that grants awarded under this
			 Act are of sufficient size and scope to enable grantees to carry out all
			 required activities and otherwise meet the purpose of this Act, except that an
			 eligible entity may not be awarded more than $250,000 per fiscal year under
			 this Act.

text.#text: The

An eligible
			 entity receiving a grant under this Act shall provide non-Federal matching
			 funds in an amount equal to not less than 25 percent of the costs of the
			 activities for which assistance is sought. Such non-Federal matching funds may
			 be in cash or in-kind.

Funds made available under this Act shall be used to
			 supplement, not supplant, other Federal, State, or private funds that would
			 otherwise be expended to carry out fire safety education programs.

An eligible entity
			 receiving a grant under this Act shall use grant funds to initiate, expand, or
			 improve a fire safety education program that—

in the case of an
			 eligible entity that is an institution of higher education, reaches, to the
			 extent practicable, all students enrolled in the institution of higher
			 education, including students living on-campus and off-campus;

is carried out in
			 a manner to ensure maximum exposure to, increased awareness of, and effectuate
			 change in behavior with respect to fire safety by students through—

conducting
			 outreach to students at a minimum of twice per academic year (at the beginning
			 of the fall and spring semesters, or the equivalent); and

includes minimum
			 instruction with respect to—

awareness of fire
			 behavior;

mechanisms of fire
			 injury and death;

common ignition
			 scenarios;

fire safety
			 systems such as automatic fire sprinklers;

fire
			 alarms;

fire
			 extinguishers;

importance of
			 means of egress;

fire prevention techniques that may prevent
			 a fire from occurring (such as candle safety, cooking safety, and smoking
			 safety); and

fire safety
			 actions to be taken if a fire occurs to minimize the potential for death,
			 injury, and property damage (such as knowing how to use a fire extinguisher,
			 how to put out a cooking fire, calling 911, and evacuating); and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Campus Fire Safety Education Act of 2013/s:4/ss:b

text.#text:
includes a mechanism for carrying out the
			 evaluations described in

Not
			 later than 6 months after the end of an eligible entity’s grant period, the
			 eligible entity shall—

conduct an
			 evaluation on the effectiveness of the program carried out by the entity in
			 increasing awareness or improving fire safety behavior at such entity;
			 and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a report on the results of the evaluation conducted by the
			 entity.

text.#text:
prepare and submit
			 to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and annually thereafter, the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Campus Fire Safety Education Act of 2013/s:4/ss:b/p:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall provide to
a report that includes the following:

text.#text:
Not later than 12
			 months after the date of receipt of the first report submitted pursuant to

The number and
			 types of eligible entities receiving assistance under this Act.

The fire safety
			 education programs being implemented with assistance under this Act and the
			 costs of such programs.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to be useful in evaluating the overall
			 effectiveness of the program established under this Act in improving the fire
			 safety knowledge of college students.

text.#text:
Any other
			 information determined by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, in
			 consultation with the
, shall use the information provided under

to publish a report of best practices for initiating, expanding,
			 or improving fire safety education programs that shall be made available to all
			 institutions of higher education and other interested parties.

In this Act:
